Reopen, please! Very useful thing!
@mistercrunch please reopen.
@mistercrunch please reopen. It still is a regression of what once used to work...
@mistercrunch please reopen
@mistercrunch please reopen unless reported to be solved. I cannot evaluate the latest version at the moment, though...

@hajdbo I can take a look at this in the coming days. Just curious, have you run into this on other database types as well? i don't have a MySQL installation readily at hand, but can  set one up if needed. Btw, naming a column "date" seems slightly risky, calling it account_date or similar might save trouble down the road.
@mistercrunch please reopen, as this can lead to missed data points, which in my eyes is pretty severe.
@mistercrunch please reopen, as it is a regression of what once used to work. In my eyes this is the main purpose of having a default time column defined in the table definition.
@mistercrunch please reopen
Looks like an nvd3 bug to me.
This should actually be fixed since https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/4651
Let's talk about what to do around filters, it may be easy to pass them as `extra_filters`
The new `react-select` component that replaced the old jquery plugin doesn't support reordering. It would be a pre-req for this feature to be added to `react-select` for us to enable it.
We're not planning on enabling any type of crossfiltering (client side dynamic filtering) support to the dashboard controller for the reasons cited above.

Pretty sure this represents the SQL we're sending to the database driver (dbapi) which has its own `%`-based formatting function. While we know what it receives I don't think we have a handle on its internal formatting function.

You are changing the semantics though, and not sure the change in semantics won't introduce issues. What database are you using?

But what if the user would like to resolve minor differences and thus prefers .2% or even .3%? We do have use cases from both...

@williaster Did the issue around testing with Prod data resolve?
Thanks for all the great work. This is awesome.

I thought about this as I was doing the original change: maybe in the future we'll have a controls side-effect effect framework where checking the box can change the format once, but user can still alter it. We can an issue for this but I don't think it's as pressing as this was.
LGTM
Can one of you with cratedb setup in their env try this and report how whether it works?
Can't recall creating it. Could also be that it failed half way through before or timed out and got this error the next time around... Dunno.
I changed the logic to update the db's sate to timeout before it responds to polls.

Appreciated your work!

Which superset version will this PR go to?

Jiaxu,
刘佳旭

@mistercrunch This is a genuine issue and seems like a violation of permissions. Can somebody please look into this. 

User with a "gamma" + datasource role isn't able to query "main" database in SQL Lab, but is able to query other databases even without datasource/database permissions on those databases.
Never-mind, the results were coming from cache. This is working as expected.
@mistercrunch: Is there PR for this? Any updates on this?

At time of ingestion you create an approxHistogramFold, you can then create metrics based on that histogram in superset.

in ingestion schema:
            { "type" : "approxHistogramFold", "name" : "hist_response_time", "fieldName" : "response_time", "resolution" : 50},

metric json spec:
{ "type" : "quantile", "name" : "hist_response_time", "fieldName" : "hist_response_time",
  "probability" : 0.95 }

For me it still does only sort alphabetically.
> "version": "0.24.0"

For example: it does not work when ordering months given as strings or numbers.

 I think it would be a great improvement to customize the exact column order manually or even change the column labels.

this code should do the work :

```
scheme = request.scheme  
return Response(  
            '{scheme}://{request.headers[Host]}/{directory}?r={obj.id}'.format(  
             scheme = scheme, request=request, directory=directory, obj=obj),  
            mimetype='text/plain')
```

@mistercrunch Can we actually re-open it? I'm using the latest `0.24.0` within docker (https://github.com/amancevice/superset). In front of this container, I have nginx where my SSL certificate is installed.

Everything is working fine, except that I have superset in an Iframe, and that as soon as the user login, it gets redirected to HTTP and the browser doesn't like it...

Here is the call I'm making to the login page with the user being login already, and how it gets redirected back an forth:

```
=> https://superset.example.com/login/
-> (301) http://superset.example.com
-> (302) https://superset.example.com
-> (301) http://superset.example.com/welcome/
-> (302) https://superset.example.com/welcome/
```

The `301` is happening because I have a rule in nginx to force HTTPS. However the issue is with the application [`redirect()`](https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/fd84fd89ce12388d4aa4c98bc3d0d1257d355168/superset/__init__.py#L152)


from sqlalchemy import *

table = Table('Weekly_trial.hour_timeband_mapping', MetaData(bind=engine), autoload=True)

I ran the above code in command promt in windows 10 in python module.

Please let me know If I am doing anything wrong.

Also I am running these commands from my command promt. I am still unsure of how my superset will be connected to Bigquery. I have not provided any credentials anywhere nor has it been mentioned anywhere. It would be great If anyone can give any clarity on that as well.

@swamy16 Not sure what's happening, but it seems like it doesn't recognize BigQuery and is trying to use pyodbc db-api instead. I would recommend asking SQLAlchemy community about this.

To run BigQuery in Superset just install pybigquery in the environment with your Superset:
```pip install pybigquery --upgrade```

Afterwards, create a new Database in Superset (menu Source > Databases) and use the connection string `bigquery://your_project_id`.

for your first question : it's a probleme when your server accept only https request. In this case we would like to respond with the same scheme than the request to be sure the server can handle it.
